description:
Job Description: Chief of Staff
Location: Los Angeles, CA
Company: Nuey Aesthetics (“Nuey”)
About Us:
Nuey is one of the few well-capitalized medspa concepts engineered to optimize unit economics and achieve sustainable growth by merging expert practitioners, hospitality-driven design & service, and targeted digital marketing campaigns. With a strong focus on helping our clients achieve graceful aging, we aim to redefine beauty enhancement through unrivaled expertise and trust. As the premier destination for today’s most discerning clients, Nuey blends cutting-edge techniques with a guest-centric philosophy. Our elite team of providers, holistic approach, and unwavering commitment to personalized care position us as the trusted partner in one’s lifelong journey of skin health. Here, we strive to set a new standard in aesthetic care that blends advanced science with individual needs at every age, and every stage.
Position Overview:
As the Chief of Staff, you will have unrivaled access to executive leadership, playing a critical role in supporting all aspects of business operations, strategic planning, and execution. The Chief of Staff will act as a trusted advisor to the executive team, ensuring that strategic initiatives are implemented effectively and are aligned with the company's goals. The Chief of Staff role is designed to provide significant opportunities for career advancement. Applicants should have the capabilities to one day be a leader at Nuey, overseeing important business functions.
Key Responsibilities:
* Strategic Planning and Execution: Assist the executive team in developing and executing the company’s strategic initiatives. This includes leading new store openings and being point person with various third parties.
* Communication: Serve as a liaison between the executive team and various stakeholders, including key employees, advisors, investors, vendors and other third-party relationships. Ensure clear and effective communication of the executive team's vision and priorities.
* Confidential Support: Handle sensitive and confidential information with the utmost discretion and professionalism given the unfiltered access to executive leadership.
* Meeting Preparation: Prepare agendas, presentations, and materials for executive meetings. Attend meetings with the executive team and track action items and follow-ups.
* Research and Data Analysis: Analyze business performance data and provide insights and recommendations to the executive team to drive growth and profitability.
* Special Projects: Take on special projects and initiatives as directed by the executive team, providing leadership and support to ensure successful outcomes.
Qualifications:
* Experience: 2-6 years of experience in consulting, startups, technology, investment banking, or accounting.
* Skills:
* Proven project management skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Highly analytical with problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
* Personal Attributes:
* Operate with integrity and professionalism.
* Strong work ethic and willingness to take on any assignment.
* Good interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with stakeholders at all levels.
* Proactive, self-starter with a strong sense of urgency and attention to detail.
* Flexibility and adaptability to changing priorities and business needs.
Why Join Us:
* Be part of a fast-growing, innovative company that is transforming the medspa industry.
* Work closely with executives on most important strategic initiatives.
* Opportunity for professional growth, development and upward mobility.
* Competitive compensation and benefits.

Nuey is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply.
